content.description: Stand start on huge blocky feet under the wall, both hands on small underclings under the larger overhanging section of the wall. Reach back with the left hand to a small edge, throw up a right heel-toe cam and then reach back with the right to a jug. Match the jug and topout straight up through series of juggy, but dirty, slots.Â
content.protection: Pad and spotter or a couple of pads.
content.location: On the left side of the pirate ship wall, the climb starts on the slab under the overhanging section of the wall, directly in front of the tree but trending right a few feet.

content.description: left most line. use small crimps to gain good holds on the arete, campus a move up to get set on wall, long reach to another good rail, then use thin holds to top out left of tree..
content.location: left most route... would be the bow of the ship..

content.description: same start as "port entry" but top out straight up on white quartz right of left facing flake.

On the right end of the wall, left of the block you will see two small crimp flakes. Use flakes to gain right facing holds on right arete, work up and left to get to crack/slot able the lip of overhang. Keep working left until you can use left facing flake as pinch to top out.
content.location: right end of overhang, right of blank middle.

content.description: Just to the right of the tree. Will need to stand on booster stone unless you are tall, or rig up a wooden leg to reach small crimps in dish. Campus first move to gain better holds up and right. Top out middle of overhang

Start right hand on a sloper on the top of the right end of the boulder, left hand on undercling down and left, put left foot on down and right of the starting hands and throw the right foot up to the lip of the boulder. Slap the right hand further along the lip to the left a few feet, readjust the left foot, and then match the lip. Drop the right foot and then shuffle feet and hand a few moves further left before the last move, jumping to a good hold past the lip with the right and then pull an easy topout.
content.location: This boulder is actually by itself directly in between the Normandy wall and the Pirate Ship Wall. If you are at the Pirate Ship wall this climb would be several feet to the right and above on a small boulder. If you are at Normandy, look to the left and this climb will be off to the right along the small trail to the Pirate Ship Wall and up on a small boulder.

content.description: one of several mini crags on the left side of the yellow dot trail on the southern end of the pond.
